alert.note: Alert for Pulaski; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 1:14AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Wayne and southern Pulaski Counties through 145 AM EDT... At 114 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cains Store, or 14 miles south of Liberty, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Pointer and Stab around 120 AM EDT. Nancy, Pulaski County Park, Naomi and Hogue around 125 AM EDT. Frazer around 130 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Somerset, Burnside, Elihu, Somerset Pulaski Airport, Bronston, General Burnside S.P., Quinton, Tateville, Ruth, Sloans Valley, Grade, Dykes and Alpine. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
